definition: lapel/overlap of Chinese gown/fig. bosom (the seat of emotions)/to cherish (ambition, desires, honorable intentions etc) in one's bosom
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)

sentences.english: Open-minded religions Kuang large, detached spirit of this world.
sentences.chinese: 宗教有襟懷曠大，超脫現世之精神。

sentences.english: Next, an analysis of Professor Hsiao's commentary style in annotating lyric is followed, so as to see his great learning and personality.
sentences.chinese: 再者，分析蕭先生的評賞風格，以見學人的襟懷氣度。

sentences.english: Country full of open-minded hatred of hate at home, Wu may not want to sit still.
sentences.chinese: 國恨家仇滿襟懷，伍子胥可不願坐以待斃。

sentences.english: Well, I was perfectly honest and square with her;
sentences.chinese: 不過，我對她可是襟懷坦白，光明正大。

sentences.english: He didn't force himself to dream big and to expand the company too fast.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有強迫自己去襟懷胸襟大志或是去迅速擴張公司。

definition: see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
past events/relics from a former age/ruins
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
object of ridicule/laughingstock/to laugh over sth/to make light chat
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
Baqiao District of Xi’an 西安市[Xi1 an1 Shi4], Shaanxi
